document_title: Cerebral infarction: causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Subjects at high risk of cerebral infarction are often people with a history of high blood pressure, diabetes, cerebrovascular disease, blood clotting disorders... These are factors that increase the likelihood of developing a stroke. Abnormal thrombosis, or damage to the inner lining of the cerebral artery, leading to cerebral infarction.
In addition, people who regularly smoke and drink too much alcohol; People who are obese, sedentary, and have high cholesterol; People who are constantly stressed and anxious are also susceptible to cerebral infarction, even in young people.
